alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 7:16AM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 715 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms over the last 12 hours. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Flat Creek at Highway U, Greasy Creek at Farm Road 2290, Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145 and Flat Creek at Highway Y. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cassville, Seligman, Exeter, Galena, Washburn, Shell Knob, Mccord Bend and Golden. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
